body_html:
@jaskarannagi19 since you're using Anaconda, you should use https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path . If you don't want to use the script, you have to use https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#custom-anaconda-install .

When you have Anaconda but build Caffe2 without the conda-specific flags then you get the problem you have, where Caffe2 is installed into /usr/local , where your Python installation is not set up to look for it there. You might also fix your problem by adding /usr/local to your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, but this can likely break other packages installed on your system.

You might also fix your problem by adding /usr/local to your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, but this can likely break other packages installed on your system.
body:
@jaskarannagi19 since you're using Anaconda, you should use https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path . If you don't want to use the script, you have to use https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#custom-anaconda-install .

When you have Anaconda but build Caffe2 without the conda-specific flags then you get the problem you have, where Caffe2 is installed into /usr/local , where your Python installation is not set up to look for it there. You might also fix your problem by adding /usr/local to your LD_LIBRARY_PATH, but this can likely break other packages installed on your system.
